Triggering Event: In the middle of a chaotic classroom, she noticed an unopened letter addressed to her tucked into her planner. The school stamp indicated it had arrived three days ago. She felt her heart race as she wondered what urgent matter was now demanding her attention, adding to her already overwhelming pile of work.
Generated Assessment: She can't believe this is happening again. This time it's so obvious, yet she still has to remind herself. "It's just a stupid letter," she says aloud, as if trying to convince herself more than anyone else. "Why are you even bothered?" Her voice rises, betraying her attempt at rationality. Why does this letter have to be another thing she needs to worry about? It's like the universe is conspiring against her, always pushing her to deal with something new, never letting her catch up. This is such a ridiculous waste of time. I have enough on my plate already. But no, the letter is still there, waiting for her to open it, reminding her that her inbox isn't empty after all. She thinks back to how stressed she was when the last one came in. How could she forget that? Now she's dealing with this one too? It feels like everything is piling up, and nothing gets any easier. How can this keep happening? First, it was the phone call from her mom about the family trip, then the email about the class project, followed by the reminder about the dentist appointment. Each day brings new tasks and worries, leaving her feeling overwhelmed. And now, here’s this letter, which probably doesn’t even require action. But why bother putting it off? It’ll just sit there, annoying her until she opens it. She wonders if she'll ever get used to all these things, or will they

Triggering Event: He was sorting through old patient files in the basement of the hospital, his gnarled fingers tracing the faded ink. A file slipped from his grasp, landing open at a familiar name - the girl who had died years ago, her young face smiling up at him from the photograph. He remembered the mistake he'd made that day, the medicine he'd administered too late. His heart sank as the remorse washed over him like a tidal wave, drowning out the quiet of the basement.
Generated Assessment: Oh boy, you're really going to make me feel bad today. I've been here for 25 years, and it's always the same thing. I'm just an old man, sitting in my chair, waiting for someone else to die so I can get off work. And then there's this one guy, he was supposed to be dead 10 years ago, but nope, still here. Now he's dying again. It's always the same story with him, he dies, and I have to go back in time and fix everything all over again. But what does that tell me? That I'm incompetent. I'm a failure, and nothing ever goes right. This is always how it goes - I mess up, everyone suffers, and I'm the reason why. So yeah, let's just sit here and wait for more people to die so we can repeat the cycle.

Triggering Event: Male artist, 28, is at an art exhibition where his work is featured alongside those of more established artists. He overhears a critic dismissing his paintings as "unrefined" and "lacking depth," while praising another artist's work as "a testament to maturity." He feels a surge of resentment, clenching his fists in his pockets, wishing he could confront the critic but holds back, instead excusing himself to brood alone in the dimly lit gallery hall.

I bet he doesn't even have a clue about what it takes to create something like this. No wonder he gets away with it - he's just another rich, entitled asshole who thinks he can trash anyone he wants because they're "new" and don't have connections yet. That other artist? They must be getting paid for that shit. I mean, come on - painting abstracts that look like they were made by a toddler? It's disgusting. And don't even get me started on the other stuff he said. It's all just shallow, surface-level criticism designed to make him sound smart and important. I swear, some critics are just jealous that they're not actually good artists themselves. This whole thing just makes my blood boil. I feel like I need to say something, but I know nothing will happen anyway. It's always the same bullshit. People like this think they're above everyone else just because they have a degree or whatever. Like, newsflash: having an education doesn’t automatically make you better than everyone else. Sometimes I wish there was a way to tell them that, but of course, they'd just deny it and keep pretending like they’re the best thing since sliced bread. Anyway, I guess I'll just leave and forget about it. But man, I want to do something... fuck, why can't

Triggering Event: A parent approached him after class, pulling out a crumpled note from their child's backpack. "Is this yours?" they asked, holding up a love letter written in his handwriting, intended for someone else but mistakenly included among today's lesson plans. He felt his face grow warm as he realized the entire class had likely seen it before it was handed over.
Generated Assessment: "Wow, I guess my classmates were really bored during class today because they're all so invested in my personal life. It's hilarious how everyone must be talking about me right now, probably speculating about who the note is for, and what kind of relationship we have. I mean, who wouldn't want to know? Maybe it's just a coincidence that everyone saw it before it even reached them, huh? Yeah, totally normal." #Example 1 - The Blame Shift Teacher: "You need to stop being late. You're disrupting the whole class." Student: "If you were more organized with your schedule, then maybe I wouldn’t be late so often. But no, instead you’re always late yourself, so why bother changing?" #Example 2 - The Overgeneralization Friend: "I’m going to the party tonight, wanna come?" Me: “Well, I’ve been feeling pretty anxious lately, so I don’t think I’ll go. Plus, I heard some people at school are acting really weird lately, so I don’t want to get involved in whatever drama’s going down. And honestly, parties aren’t my thing anyway. I’m good skipping it.” #Example 3 - The Minimization Cousin: “Hey, I saw you hanging out with a girl today. What’s going on between you two?” Me: “Nothing, she’s just a friend. We were just grabbing coffee together like usual. Don

Triggering Event: She returned home to an empty house, the echo of her footsteps betraying the silence. The dining table still held the remnants of last night's dinner for two, but only one chair was pushed in.
Generated Assessment: Oh my god you won’t believe what happened I’m literally shaking right now she came back from work early like 6 hours ago and went straight to bed like it’s no big deal and then this morning I wake up and there is no note she left me saying how much she loves me and that she can’t wait until tonight when we’re going out. And then I see the empty seat at the table with two plates and glasses and it just makes me so angry I thought we were exclusive she told me that we are, but then why is she sleeping alone? Why does she leave her phone on full charge all day while I have to worry about running out of battery? And the worst part is, I feel like she doesn’t even care about our relationship anymore. She never told me anything about her job, but maybe she got fired? Or maybe she has a new boyfriend who is staying with her? Or maybe she just didn’t want to talk to me today because I was being too clingy? Or maybe she just doesn’t love me anymore? But no she wouldn’t say something like that would she? She knows that I love her more than anything in this world. So why isn’t she trying to hide it? Why is she acting like everything is normal when it’s clearly not? I don’t know what to think anymore. Maybe I’m overreacting. But honestly, I am so confused. I thought we had something real, something special. Now

Triggering Event: His partner of five years casually mentioned over breakfast, "I think we should consider living apart for a while, you know, to focus on our careers." He watched as she sipped her coffee, oblivious to the bitter taste it left in his mouth.
Generated Assessment: He was already feeling like shit that morning because he had just received news that his favorite band was canceling all upcoming shows due to illness. Then, on top of that, his girlfriend casually dropped a bombshell about living apart for a while. She wasn't even upset about it; she seemed more excited than anything else, but it still felt like a punch to the gut. First off, why would she suggest this? Doesn't she understand how much I need her right now? We're supposed to be supporting each other through these tough times, not tearing us further apart. It's so unfair that she can just bring up something like this without even considering how it'll affect me. If I have to deal with one thing at a time, does she really want me to handle another major change too? This is so fucking ridiculous. Living apart? Are you kidding me? What if things get worse between us? Would she leave me then? And what about everything else? How am I supposed to cope with my anxiety when she's going to be gone most of the time? Does she expect me to magically figure everything out without her here to support me? And don't even get me started on her career. She's always been super driven, and now she wants to add another job to her plate? That means even less time for us together. It's so fucking selfish. Can't she see how this will hurt me? What's next? Is she planning on leaving me altogether?

Triggering Event: She felt her cheeks flush as she overheard the gallery owner whispering to a client, "I'm not sure how much longer we can keep selling these... it's not like they're going to be worth anything in a few years." Her eyes darted to her latest painting, prominently displayed and already sold, but now seemed tainted by the dismissive words. She wanted to shrink into the plush carpet beneath her feet as she pretended to examine another piece, trying desperately to hide her embarrassment.
Generated Assessment: She was just soooo happy when I got my first solo show at this quaint little art gallery, and I was really excited about the reviews! But then I heard the gallery owner muttering something about how my paintings wouldn't last long and how they weren't worth anything soon. Ugh, it makes me feel so awful and embarrassed. Like, why did I even bother? Maybe I'll just go home and stay there forever. This whole thing is making me super uncomfortable. I hate this anxiety feeling, it’s just ruining everything. I wish I could get rid of it, but it won't leave me alone. It’s like it’s haunting me right now. I’m just sitting here with my hands shaking and my heart pounding, and I really want to just disappear. This is all because of one stupid comment from some guy who doesn’t understand what he’s saying. I know he didn’t mean it, but honestly, what’s the point? Everything feels so fake right now, especially since I’ve been working hard for months. I guess I just need to stop caring about his opinion and focus on myself instead. But the more I think about it, the worse I feel. Maybe I’ll just go back to my room and try to forget about this whole thing. At least there, I can pretend nothing ever happened. It’s such a shame, too. I had finally gotten my first solo show, and everyone was telling me how great it looked. The owner

Triggering Event: He noticed her smile at the younger officer as they passed in the hall, a warmth he hadn't seen directed towards him in years.
Generated Assessment: Oh, how the world has changed for me in this moment. The young man who had been so kind to me all these years now looks at me with disdain. It's clear that I'm no longer the one he wants to help, but rather some inferior who can't be bothered with my problems. His eyes have hardened, and his voice is cold, like ice. Every word he speaks is laced with contempt, each gesture a slap in the face. This isn't just about being wronged; it goes deeper than that. To see someone I once thought was a friend turn against me like this, to know that he thinks less of me than he did before, is a blow that cuts right to the heart. It feels like the very foundations of our relationship are crumbling, like sand beneath my feet. Nothing will ever be the same again. How could he treat me like this? How could something as simple as a smile change everything between us? In the past, I thought we were close friends, but now I realize that he never truly liked me. It wasn't just about helping me; it was about something more fundamental—a sense of superiority. And now, with this single act, he's made it clear that he sees me as nothing more than a failure, a reminder of his own inadequacy. This isn't just a betrayal; it's a reflection of who I am—a person who isn't good enough. Everything I once held dear—the memories we shared

Triggering Event: He noticed she'd left her phone unlocked, displaying a text from an old flame: "Still think about you."
Generated Assessment: He was furious upon noticing his ex-girlfriend's phone had been left unlocked, revealing a message that made him feel like he'd been replaced. The text, which read "Still think about you," seemed to suggest she hadn't moved on and still harbored feelings for him. He felt betrayed by this revelation, as if she was playing games with him again.

Triggering Event: A week into her retirement, she found an old patient's chart in the attic, yellowed and forgotten. It was Mrs. Thompson's, a woman she'd cared for years ago, who had passed away alone despite her devoted care. She noticed a handwritten note tucked inside: "Nurse could've done more." Bitterness surged as she realized it was in her own handwriting, a reminder of self-imposed guilt she thought she'd buried long ago.
Generated Assessment: Oh my god, I feel so fucking awful! I can't believe how much guilt is still there. I don't know why this stupid letter came back to haunt me, but I'm just consumed with regret now. I think about what I could've done differently every day, and it makes me so angry at myself. That stupid note always made me so furious when I saw it - like, why did she have to remind me? Doesn't she know I've been trying to forget all these things for years? I hate that I'm still thinking about it, and I hate even more that I let those thoughts ruin my happiness. But then again, maybe I shouldn't be surprised; I always knew I wasn't perfect, especially back then. What if I really didn't do enough for Mrs. Thompson? What if I missed something important? Oh man, I wish I could erase everything from 20 years ago. If only I could go back and change things, I would've done better. But no, I'm stuck here, feeling guilty and resentful. I feel like such a failure because of that stupid note, and I'm so angry at myself for being weak and holding onto all this shit. I wish I could just move on, but I guess I'll never be able to fully let go. I keep replaying that moment over and over, wondering if I could've done anything different. I wish I could turn back time and make it right, but I know
